page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The most significant feature of the area is the part that it plays in the transport network. The river Kennet had been extensively used in medieval and earlier times; the Kennet and Avon canal was of importance for 50 years until the coming of the Great Western Railway in the 1840's. Since the 1840's most of the area has been owned and farmed by the Benyon family of Englefield House. They bought the land at auction from the bankrupt owner of Ufton Court. The maroon coloured doors used by the Englefield Estate are to be seen on almost all of the 19th century buildings in the area, demonstrating the extent of the Englefield Estate's holdings even today. So few medieval records appear to survive for this area that it is impossible to reconstruct the medieval environment.
